newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHENS FIRST AIR-CONDITIONED BUS TO BE PRESENTED FRIDAY.
newsitem.headline: ATHENS FIRST AIR-CONDITIONED BUS TO BE PRESENTED FRIDAY.

text.p: The Athens will present its first air-conditioned public bus on Friday, just in time for winter.

It is the first of 300 buses which will have air-conditioning, the Athens urban transportation organisation (OASA) said in a statement. It will be presented at 1100 local at the departure point of Vassileos Herakliou street.

The city's bus fleet, acquired over the past three years, was designed for Northern European countries and passengers were having a hard time coping with sweltering summer heat. An elderly man died in one of the buses because of heat last summer. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
